title: Minor League Strength and Conditioning Coach
content:
Title: Minor League Strength and Conditioning CoachReports to: Minor League Strength and Conditioning CoordinatorLocation: Clearwater, FLStatus: Full-Time
Position Overview
The Minor League Strength and Conditioning Coach will oversee all aspects of strength, mobility, speed, agility, flexibility, conditioning and recovery for every player at their given affiliate for the Philadelphia Phillies Baseball Organization. The primary function of this position is to take the program set forth by our Director of Strength and Conditioning and Minor League Strength and Conditioning Coordinator and properly introduce it to their assigned players. The Minor League Strength and Conditioning Coach will serve as a member of the performance staff.
Responsibilities

Properly integrate a comprehensive strength and conditioning program to MiLB Players
Collaborate with Dietitians on minor league catering at given affiliate
Maintain a productive affiliate weight room
Report necessary capital improvements to MiLB Strength Coordinator
Execute in-season testing on a schedule set forth by MiLB Strength Coordinator
Attend Spring Training and help with all testing and implementation of strength program
Yearly visit to Dominican Academy to aid with program implementation

SPRING TRAINING:

Assist performance and conditioning testing on Minor League players
Input testing data into our Athlete Management System
Individualize assigned athletes tissue prep and strength program based on testing
Lead daily warm-ups with the athletes
Aid with MLB Strength Training at the guidance of the Director
Daily cleaning of the Carpenter Complex weight room

IN-SEASON:

Lead strength and conditioning program for the athletes at given affiliate
Complete performance testing on players at the frequency set forth by MiLB Coordinator
Daily reports and compliance entry to be completed on our AMS
Provide training plan for rehabilitation players, if any, at affiliate
Continue assessment of player dashboards as it pertains to continued testing
Assist MiLB dietitian in the ordering of pre-game and post-game meals for athletes, both home and on the road
Complete pre-season, mid-season and end of season self-evaluation forms
Integrate the Rookie Development Program for all newly drafted players into our system, if applicable
Participate in monthly Zoom calls with the Strength and Conditioning Staff
Provide end of season goals for affiliate roster
Perform any other task designated by the Minor League Strength and Conditioning Coordinator

OFF-SEASON:

Participate in all off-season Zoom calls/meetings
Attend at least one Continue Education event
Attend Organizational Meetings
Communicate with assigned players on a bi-monthly basis for check-ups and program compliance
Attend the off-season strength camp as directed by MiLB Strength Coordinator
Potentially aid the Director of Strength and Conditioning Coach for in person player follow ups

Required Qualifications

BS in Exercise Physiology, Kinesiology, Exercise Science, or related field
Active CSCS through the National Strength and Conditioning Association
Minimum 1-2 years of experience in strength and conditioning working with elite athletes at the professional or collegiate level

Preferred Qualifications

MS in Exercise Physiology, Kinesiology, Exercise Science, or related field
Active RSCC through the National Strength and Conditioning Association
Proficiency in Spanish language

 
The Phillies are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and are committed to growing a workforce diverse in perspective and background. We proudly strive to build a group of employees who represent the fans and communities we currently, and aim to serve.
